metadata.synopsis: Avatar and Astarion discuss the encounter with the Blood Merchant. She tried to convince Astarion to bite her and he was very much against it.

14.speaker: Astarion
14.text: The way she leered at me... the blood merchant... I can't get it out of my head...

46.speaker: Astarion
46.text: It isn't like me. Not like me at all. I was being too precious, wasn't I? We could have used her potion.

3.speaker: Astarion
3.text: A moment of unpleasantry doesn't matter if there's a fine reward. I should have just gritted my teeth as always and let her have me for a bit.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Why has she upset you so much?

33.speaker: Astarion
33.text: There's nothing more desirable in the world than a vampire, is there?

13.speaker: Astarion
13.text: And when you've been through all I have, you damn well are going to fight with what few assets the gods give you.

31.speaker: Astarion
31.text: But... a part of me feels sick when I think about getting on my back for breadcrumbs again.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: You have so much more than your looks going for you.

15.speaker: Astarion
15.text: I had nothing at all for so long. Not even my body - that was owned by Cazador, to be sent out to tempt fools into his palace.

51.speaker: Astarion
51.text: I have bedded thousands of people. Half of them I barely remember. Most of them didn't even grant me temporary bliss.

48.speaker: Astarion
48.text: It should have been so easy to let the drow use me for her fantasy, but perhaps - you showed me I have enough strength - I don't need to.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: You aren't a slave now, Astarion, you're free.

40.speaker: Astarion
40.text: I can stop using myself. Stop being used.

6.speaker: Astarion
6.text: It isn't worth the scars, anymore.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: And I would never ask you to.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: You have a great power over people. You should see it as a strength, not a weakness.

37.speaker: Astarion
37.text: Well... perhaps I should see it that way, after all.

1.speaker: Astarion
1.text: It isn't humiliating to use myself as a weapon. It's degrading that people like her fall for it. Over and over again.

49.speaker: Astarion
49.text: Charm is just another spell we cast.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: 'I'm too pretty' is a bit of a sore complaint.

44.speaker: Astarion
44.text: I am too pretty, you're right.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Have you even enjoyed having sex, in the last decades?

32.speaker: Astarion
32.text: Enjoyment? That didn't come into it. I never had a choice.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Our lives are on the line here. We take every advantage we can get.

23.speaker: Astarion
23.text: I could have lived eternally in Cazador's pleasure chambers. I'm not afraid to die. I'm afraid I'll never have a new life after that.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: It makes me sad to hear you talk about yourself like that.

9.speaker: Astarion
9.text: Why? I'm simply trying to be realistic.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: This really isn't like you at all.

30.speaker: Astarion
30.text: No, it isn't. Even if I'm free, I can't escape my body, and the truths about it I know:

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Well, it's done now. Let's not dwell on it.

12.speaker: Astarion
12.text: Next time, I won't be so stroppy. No point not using all the assets the gods give us.

22.speaker: Astarion
22.text: I did what I always did. I let her use me. Why does it feel different to all the other times, then?

35.speaker: Astarion
35.text: Yes... I think something is wrong.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Oh, Astarion, I'm really sorry for making you do it.

7.speaker: Astarion
7.text: All the promiscuous jibes paint a picture of someone who would relish the deed... You couldn't really have known.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: You still chose to do it.

29.speaker: Astarion
29.text: I forced myself to do it.

55.speaker: Astarion
55.text: I thought it would be nothing at all to sell myself to that drow's fantasies. But the price was higher than I imagined. I don't want to do it again.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: You can start anew now. Free.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: You have a great power over people. Don't squander it.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: You're growing soft - don't let it get to you.

47.speaker: Astarion
47.text: Ugh, I suppose I'll forget it, in time. I always do.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Because you got to keep the reward, rather than give it to your master?

59.speaker: Astarion
59.text: I'll drink that potion and never think about it again afterwards. But what I had to do to get it is going to stay...

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Forget about it, it was worth it for the potion.
